datafield.subfield: Influence of Particle Shape on Mechanical Behavior of Granular Materials

The purpose of this paper is to explore the influence of particle shape on the mechanical behaviors of granular materials using the discrete element method (DEM). Particles with random polygonal shapes were generated using ‘clumps’ (groups of circular particles). The relationships between the particle-scale parameters and the macroscopic responses of granular materials were identified by simulating the biaxial compression tests on numerical samples. The effects of particle shape on the shear strength and deformation of granular materials were analyzed. The micromechanics of the macroscopic responses were investigated through a variety of mechanism demonstrations and micromechanical analysisMicroscopic analysis .
